64
A WILL MADE IN FRONT OF WITNESSES
(1) A testator who is able to read and write may make a will by signing, in front of two witnesses, in his or her own hand a document drawn up by another person while at the same time declaring in front of two witnesses that it is his or her will.
(2) The two witnesses shall sign the will, with the postscript that they are signing the will as witnesses. Such postscript is not a condition for the validity of the will.
